						WEDNESDAY 11 APRIL 22:30 BST - BBC TWO


						FROM GAVIN ESLER
					
					Hello, 



						And today's Quote for Today: 


"My wife is starting to refer to me as her first husband. It's a little disturbing" - Barack Obama, would-be Democrat candidate for the US Presidency, on how his campaign is keeping him away from home.


In tonight's programme:


ETHICAL MAN IS COMPOST 


Newsnight has decided to kill off its Ethical Man. After a year of trying to live with due consideration to his impact on the planet, Justin Rowlatt is moving on to other challenges. 


But the serious point behind the project was to try to gauge what difference an individual can make to the environment. 


Justin will conclude his series of reports and will join in the debate with those who can make an even bigger difference, including the Environment Secretary David Miliband.

Ethical end - trailer


THE MoD AND IRAN 


The Defence Secretary Des Browne has admitted errors were made in the handling of the Iranian hostages. 


We'll hear from a Lib Dem spokesman whose also a former RAF officer on how he sees the difficulties of adapting the military machine to the demands of 24 hour news. 


AND FINALLY


Today's Joke Fit For an Eleven Year Old comes from Newsnight viewer Zombie: 


An English doctor is being shown around a Scottish hospital. At the end of his visit, he is shown into a ward with a number of patients who show no obvious signs of injury. He goes to examine the first patient he sees, and the man proclaims:


"Fair fa' yer honest, sonsie face,

Great chieftain o' the puddin' race!"


The English doctor, somewhat taken aback, goes to the next patient, and immediately the patient launches into:


"Some hae meat and canna eat,

And some wad eat that want it."


This continues with the next patient:


"Wee sleekit cow'rin tim'rous beastie,

O what a panic's in thy breastie!"


"Well," the English doctor mutters to his Scottish colleague, "I see you saved the psychiatric ward for the last."


"Oh no," the Scottish doctor corrected him, "this is the serious Burns unit."  


Newsnight is at 10.30 on BBC2.


Gavin
